p: To evaluate the protective effect of maternal antibodies on neonatal mice, female mice aged 6 weeks were immunized. Each mouse was immunized with 10 μg fusion protein vaccine candidate, and their immunity was boosted 3 weeks later at the same dose and volume. One week later, female mice were allowed to mate. Sera for the determination of the neutralization titer to analyze cross-reactivity were collected from the female mice at 1 week, 4 weeks, 5 weeks, and 8 weeks after the first immunization. Six female mice were immunized for each group, including fusion protein vaccine candidate group, inactivated virus group and E. coli lysate group. For viral infection experiments, 12–15 neonatal mice born by immunized female mice were used for each group.
